intro: Miquelia caudata, commonly known as the long-tailed miquelias, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Magnoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as a deciduous tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly waxy texture. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
